User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b12) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b12
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b12) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b12

If you have 2 tabs open and pin one tab as an app, you can close the unippned tab leaving only the pinned tab, then you can click on a bookmark or hit the home button in firefox and it will open a new tab in order to not disturb the pin app,  but when you click on bookmarks and go to a folder and click on open all in tabs, the pinned app will browse over to the location of the first book mark instead of opening it in a new tab,  this behavior doesn't seem like the proper behavior for the pinned app.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. pin a tab as an app
2. close all other tabs
3. click on a bookmark folder and hit open all in tabs
Actual Results:  
pinned app location changes

Expected Results:  
the location should stay the same and the other bookmarks opened in new tabs

none
